Preliminary analysis by Spectator reveals that other news sources have potentially underestimated Columbia property holdings

Forty-one percent of Columbia’s property holdings in New York City explicitly list Columbia in the property owner name and can be found using New York City tax lot databases.

Columbia has the most property holdings among peer private universities in New York City.

Columbia Finance listed 740 sites with property holdings.

Each building represents five property holdings. Columbia has 3.2 times the number of property holdings as New York University.

Columbia (383 property holdings)

640 properties are in New York City.

524 could be located using NYC GeoSearch.

383 had matches in PLUTO, the city’s tax lot database, with private owners listed.

120 Columbia properties have owners with names other than “Trustees of Columbia.”

NYU (119 property holdings)

263 property holdings had “Columbia” explicitly in the owner name.

Fordham University (25 property holdings)

Source: NYC PLUTO and Columbia Finance.

Graphic by Adina Cazacu-De Luca
